title: ‘We’ll see how it plays out’: Caleb Durbin, Marcelo Mayer each to practice at 2B, 3B to begin spring training
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Caleb Durbin and Marcelo Mayer to practice at second and third base during Red Sox spring training in Fort Myers.
Red Sox Manager Alex Cora has not yet determined who will primarily play third base for the 2026 season.
Boston has multiple infield options, including Durbin, Mayer, and recently signed Isiah Kiner-Falefa, suggesting potential platoons.

title: Report: Patriots QBs coach Ashton Grant to stay in New England, won’t take OC interviews
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Ashton Grant, Patriots quarterbacks coach, will stay with New England, declining OC interviews with the Raiders, Rams, and Seahawks.
Grant played a key role in quarterback Drake Maye's development and success, contributing to his near NFL MVP performance last season.
Grant began his coaching career at Holy Cross and coached with the Browns before joining the Patriots under Mike Vrabel in 2025.

title: Brighton community raises $25k for flooded barbershop
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Brighton's community raised over $25,800 for Matt's Barber Shop after a burst pipe caused flooding damage.
Customer Dietrich Warner launched a GoFundMe, shared in a local Facebook group, rapidly gaining community support.
Barber Matt Charette plans to rebuild quickly with community support; a benefit show is scheduled at O'Brien's Pub.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Eternity,' a romcom starring Elizabeth Olsen, is streaming on Apple TV.
'Harold and Maude' is available on Pluto TV; actor Bud Cort, aged 77, passed away recently.
James Van Der Beek, who starred in 'Dawson’s Creek,' died at 48; the show is on Netflix, Hulu, and Tubi.

title: Court says Mass. father’s battle over LGBTQ-friendly lessons excludes books on gender stereotypes
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Federal judge rules that books on gender stereotypes are not part of a Lexington father's lawsuit over LGBTQ-friendly lessons.
The lawsuit by Alan L. targets LGBTQ topics, not gender stereotypes in books like 'Pink Is For Boys' or 'Except When They Don’t'.
Judge Saylor states that Lexington educators aren't required to let Alan L.'s child opt out of lessons involving the two books.

title: Roman Anthony set to join Team USA for World Baseball Classic if he passes physical
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Roman Anthony is set to join Team USA for the World Baseball Classic, replacing injured Corbin Carroll.
At 21 years old, Roman Anthony would be the youngest player on Team USA's roster if he passes his physical.
Anthony's MLB debut saw him hit .292 with 8 home runs in 71 games for the Boston Red Sox last season.

title: $20M penthouse at Taylor Swift’s rumored wedding venue hits market
author: Regina Cole
bullets: Penthouse at Ocean House in Westerly, Rhode Island listed for $20 million, includes private beach access.
The 4,696 sq. ft. unit features three bedrooms, four bathrooms, and a private terrace with ocean views.
Ownership includes access to Ocean House amenities like spa, gym, wine cellar, and private beach.

title: 10 Celtics stats that should show encouragement and discouragement entering All-Star break
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Boston Celtics hold a 35-19 record, ranking second in the Eastern Conference entering the All-Star break.
Jaylen Brown is averaging 29.3 points per game, contributing to the Celtics ranking in the top three in offensive and defensive ratings.
The Celtics struggle in clutch games, with a 12-14 record, and are inconsistent in 3-point shooting, going 9-16 when shooting below 35% from deep.

title: Your Cape Cod winter guide: 20 things to do during the cold months
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Cape Cod offers winter activities across its 15 towns, from museums to nature trails, without the summer crowds.
Visitors can enjoy museums like the Sandwich Glass Museum and outdoor spots such as Herring Cove Beach's scenic winter views.
Cape Cod also features unique dining and drinking options, including Devil’s Purse Brewing Company and UVA Wine Bar.

title: She’s running Boston for people like her with Type 1 Diabetes
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Kristine Lapczynski, a 30-year-old pharmacist from North Carolina, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon.
Lapczynski aims to inspire others with Type 1 Diabetes, including her patients and daughter, by completing the marathon.
She supports Breakthrough T1D, an organization focused on diabetes research and advocacy, as a personal mission.
